response.answer_text: I would like tell you that yes economics is good a field to make career in but it requires immense subject knowledge , good writing skills , communication skills, and most importantly one should be capable of working with economics based software like e-views , sspss and many more. Economics is considered as ever green subject due to its high utility and huge demand in the job markets. Economics is a very important discipline both for career as well as job point of view. The significance of economics has greatly increased post reforms era. Job opportunities have increased manifolds post liberalisation, privatisation and globalisation (LPG), and after merging of world economy. Well-trained economists are in huge demand not only in India but also across the world for rapidly globalising economic scenario. They are hired as economic analysts, researchers and consultants. Economic Courses and Eligibility The teaching of economics started from the XI standard. To get admission in a good college, one has to secure good marks in economics at XI and XII exams. After passing B.A. in economics, one may pursue MA and Ph.D in economics with some specialization. Economics course syllabus includes the papers like mathematical economics, statistical economics, monetary economics, international economics, developmental economics, econometrics, public finance, and economic policy making. The specialisation in the field of economics increases its importance. The specialised areas are finance, agriculture, econometrics, rural development, health, business development, international economics, industrial law and human resource. Post Graduate Diploma (Econometrics) What are the Career Prospects in Economics? The career prospects for economics graduates are many. Numerous fields are waiting for economic graduates both in the public as well as the private sectors. In the government sector, one may try for Indian Economic Services, jobs in Reserve Bank of India, PSUs and other public sector banks. All these jobs have wonderful career options. These jobs give you social prestige along with financial stability. Private sector also offers jobs for economic graduates in the fields like private banks, MNCs, BPOs, KPOs, Business journals, and newspapers. A good opportunity is also waiting for economic students in higher education. One can pursue Ph.D. in economics to enter into the field of teaching in colleges and universities. One makes a successful career as a Corporate Lawyer after BA in economics followed by LLB. BA in economics and MBA placed one at a better position in the private sector. Economic Journalism is another shining area for job perspective. Meritorious candidates can get excellent job opportunities after successfully completing their BA or MA in economics. Economics graduates can get prestigious jobs in the government sectors like Indian Economic Services, Indian Civil Services, Reserve Bank of India, National Sample Survey, Ministry of Economic Affairs, Planning Board, Planning Commission, National Council for Applied Economic Research and National Institute of Public Finance and Policy. The firms like World Bank, Asian Development Bank, IMF, and other Development Banks, Aid agencies, Financial Consultancy firms are hiring the economic graduates for its various positions. One can consume in these organisations as economist, economic advisor, executive, analyst, consultant, researcher, financial analyst, business analyst, economic research analyst and stock market analyst. As far as salary is concerned, lots of candidates are hired through campus placement. The average salary is Rs 4 to 8 lakh per annum. But for the deserving candidates, the field open plethora of options and remuneration is also beyond expectation. You should consider a BA in Economics! It is one of the most sought-after courses in the Humanities. If you are new to the subject, Economics, in essence, is the complex and intellectual study of transactions. The world runs on transactions. Price rise, growth in the economy, or demand fluctuations - everything is a result of economics. It affects everyday lives and all sectors in the marketplace – notably public policy, public finance, health, agriculture, and trade, among several others. A person who completed graduation with B.A Economics is perfectly poised to understand the larger forces behind how the world turns. It places you at a double advantage – insights into the bigger picture and, therefore, fantastic opportunities in the job market. Some of the areas a student can expect to study are mathematical economics, statistical economics, public finance, international economics, developmental economics, and many more. You need to not only know your subject well but also have excellent communication skills and the ability to work with quantitative data software like SSPSS. There are unlimited career avenues for a student in Economics. The public sector requires good students of Economics in places like the RBI, Public Banks, as well as PSUs. In the corporate world, people can opt for careers in reputed MNCs, BPOs, or KPOs. People can also diversify into academia if they so choose. A PhD in Economics is much sought-after and can land you teaching jobs in the best colleges and universities in the country. Besides great learning and career opportunities, Economics is one of the most intellectually-stimulating subjects where learning never stops.
